questions.text: Where did Austria's Sturm Graz play their home games until 2005, when it was renamed UPC-Arena?
questions.explanation:
Arnold Schwarzenegger Stadiun.

	The stadium was named after the town's most famous son, who revoked the use of his name in 2005.

questions.text: Which national side play at The Azteca?
questions.explanation:
Mexico.

	The Azteca is situated in Mexico, and has also hosted American football, hosting the largest crowd in NFL history, some 112,376 people who visited the stadium to watch the Dallas Cowboys play the Houston Oilers in 1994.

questions.text: Where do England's Wolverhampton Wanderers play their home matches?
questions.explanation:
Molineux.

	Wolverhampton - or 'Wolves' as they're known - have played at Molineux since 1889 (It's been restructured plenty since then!). The stadium is named after Molineux street, where it is sited. Pronounce it 'Molly New'.

questions.text: Can you name Sunderland's OLD stadium?
questions.explanation:
Roker Park.

	They now play at the Stadium of Light. When Roker Park closed, it was almost 100 years old.

questions.text: Where would you find the Ullevi stadium?
questions.explanation:
Sweden.

	The Ullevi was built in 1958, and also hosts athletics events. Around the pitch is an running track on which three World Records have been set.

questions.text: Which French side play at Stade Louis II?
questions.explanation:
Monaco.

	The Stade Louis II, was chosen as a neutral venue for Scotland to play Estonia after floodlight failure at Estonia's ground in Tallin.

questions.text: Which German club side call the Westfalenstadion home?
questions.explanation:
Borussia Dortmund.

	Opened in 1974, the Westfalenstadion cost 32 million Deutsch Marks (around 15 and a half million US Dollars, or 10 and a half million Pounds).

questions.text: In which city would you find the Stadio Delle Alpi?
questions.explanation:
Turin & Torino.

	Stadio Delle Alpe is the home of Italian giants Juventus, and has a capacity of 71,000.

questions.text: Where did Portugal's FC Porto play in 2003?
questions.explanation: Das Antas.

questions.text: Where did Galatasaray play their home games?
questions.explanation:
Ali Sami Yen.

	The Ali Sami Yen stadium is known as 'Hell' due to the intensely volatile atmosphere inside, created by the fanatical home support.

questions.text: Which French Stadium hosted the 1998 World Cup Final between France and Brazil?
questions.explanation:
Stade de France.

	The Stade de France hosted the opening game, and the final, of the 1998 World Cup. The stadium, in Saint Denis, Paris, was purpose built for the Championships. The stadium took 31 months to build.

questions.text: In Scotland, where did Motherwell FC play?
questions.explanation:
Fir Park.

	Situated in the town of Motherwell, Lanarkshire, Fir Park hosted several matches of the 1989 Under-16 World Championships.

questions.text: Who plays at the De Kuip stadium?
questions.explanation:
Feyenoord.

	The De Kuip is located in Rotterdam, and has a capacity of 50,000. It has hosted 9 European cup finals, and also the Euro 2000 final, where France defeated Italy 1-0 thanks to David Trezeguet's goal.

questions.text: Who played at Italy's San Siro in 2000?
questions.correct: AC Milan & Milan & Inter Milan & Inter & Internazionale
questions.explanation:
AC Milan & Milan & Inter Milan & Inter & Internazionale.

	The San Siro stadium was a gift to AC Milan from Piero Pirelli, and took a year to finish.

questions.text: How many people were reputedly inside Brazil's Maracana Stadium for the 1950 World Cup Final?
questions.explanation:
200,000.

	This attendance has never been surpassed in soccer history. Uruguay won the final 2-1 after Brazil had earlier taken the lead.

questions.text: What is the name Iran's stadium?
questions.explanation:
Azadi.

	Women were not allowed in the stadium.

questions.text: What two Italian clubs groundshare the Stadio Olimpico?
questions.explanation:
Lazio and Roma.

	The Italian National side play at the Olimpico.

questions.text: Before Wimbledon groundshared with Crystal Palace, what was Wimbledon's former home ground? ( _______ Lane)
questions.explanation: Plough Lane & Plough.

questions.text: Where do English club Ipswich Town play?
questions.explanation:
Portman Road.

	Outside the ground is a statue of England's World Cup-winning manager, Sir Alf Ramsey, himself an Ipswich man.

questions.text: Who plays at the Nou Camp?
questions.explanation:
Barcelona.

	The Nou Camp is the biggest stadium in Europe. It has a capacity of 98,000. Due to the excellent facilities, the Nou Camp is regarded as the finest football stadium in Europe. It was awarded a 5 star rating by the European football governing body UEFA.
